column2: Average Class Size and Class Size Distribution (Elementary)\r2016-172016-172016-172016-172017-182017-182017-182017-182018-192018-192018-192018-19\rAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# of\rGrade\rClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*\rLevel\rSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSize\r1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+\rK\r2214185264\r\r1\r2442341931\r\r2\r254244254\r\r3\r284224254\r\r4\r313314293\r\r5\r294353304\r\r6\r281329132713\r\rOther**\r\r*Numbe r of classes indicates how many classes fall into each size category (a range of total students per class).\r** “Other” category is for multi-grade level classes.\r\r\rProfessional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement192021\r\rThe primary focus of staff development continues to be a focus on positive behavior intervention supports (PBIS) using a tiered system.  Professional\rdevelopment (PD) meetings focus on various strategies geared to address the diverse needs of students at Teague Elementary School.  A PBIS team was\rassembled and meets regularly to discuss school-wide progress in addressing the needs of at-risk students and the student population as a whole.\rTeachers also attend workshops and conferences outside of school giving them an opportunity to collaborate with other educators dealing with similar\rissues around school culture and climate.  Also
column4: all teachers are receiving training on using the Science curriculum and\rproper delivery of Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS). Teachers at Teague participate in CGI training regarding math strategies and have hosted\rtraining and provided opportunities for other educators to observe CGI strategies within the classroom setting at Teague.\r\rTeachers at Teague are also provided professional development at the district level through district-wide grade-level collaboration that affords them\ropportunities to address information regarding assessments
column9: and planning.  Teachers are supported with substitutes if PD is during the day. Most PD occurs on Wednesdays during principal days.\rTeachers are also provided with subs to meet with the principal for goal-setting meetings and data review meetings.\r\r\rState Average for\rFY 2017-18 Teacher and Administrative SalariesDistrict\rPercent of District BudgetDistricts In Same\rCategory DistrictAmount State Average for\rCategory\rDistricts In Same\rAmountTeacher Salaries32%35%\rCategory\rAdministrative Salaries5%5%\rBeginning Teacher Salary$41

column2: Average Class Size and Class Size Distribution (Elementary)\r2016-172016-172016-172016-172017-182017-182017-182017-182018-192018-192018-192018-19\rAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# of\rGrade\rClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*\rLevel\rSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSize\r1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+\rK\r2214185264\r\r1\r2442341931\r\r2\r254244254\r\r3\r284224254\r\r4\r313314293\r\r5\r294353304\r\r6\r281329132713\r\rOther**\r\r*Numbe r of classes indicates how many classes fall into each size category (a range of total students per class).\r** “Other” category is for multi-grade level classes.\r\r\rProfessional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement192021\r\rThe primary focus of staff development continues to be a focus on positive behavior intervention supports (PBIS) using a tiered system.  Professional\rdevelopment (PD) meetings focus on various strategies geared to address the diverse needs of students at Teague Elementary School.  A PBIS team was\rassembled and meets regularly to discuss school-wide progress in addressing the needs of at-risk students and the student population as a whole.\rTeachers also attend workshops and conferences outside of school giving them an opportunity to collaborate with other educators dealing with similar\rissues around school culture and climate.  Also
column4: all teachers are receiving training on using the Science curriculum and\rproper delivery of Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS). Teachers at Teague participate in CGI training regarding math strategies and have hosted\rtraining and provided opportunities for other educators to observe CGI strategies within the classroom setting at Teague.\r\rTeachers at Teague are also provided professional development at the district level through district-wide grade-level collaboration that affords them\ropportunities to address information regarding assessments
column9: and planning.  Teachers are supported with substitutes if PD is during the day.
